section.section: The Authority may consider proposals submitted by local jurisdictions to designate a heritage area as a recognized heritage area.
The Authority shall adopt regulations that specify criteria and procedures for designating recognized heritage areas.

text.section:
The Authority may not designate a heritage area as a recognized heritage area unless the Authority finds that:
The heritage area contains resources of statewide significance that have retained integrity of setting and a cohesive character;
The heritage area contains at least one or more:
Historic districts either listed in, or determined to be eligible for listing in, the Maryland Register of Historic Properties in accordance with § 5A-323 of the State Finance and Procurement Article; or
Natural or recreational resources determined by the Secretary of Natural Resources to be of statewide significance; and
Public assistance for the heritage area is reasonably expected to produce additional private investments, job creation, and tourism revenues.

section.section: The boundaries for each recognized heritage area are the boundaries depicted on the map accompanying each proposal as approved by the Authority.

After initial approval by the Authority of the boundaries of a recognized heritage area, the Authority may amend or revise the boundaries:
With the approval of all of the local jurisdictions where the property to be added or removed is located; and
On publication of a revised drawing or boundary description in the Maryland Register.
Boundary maps for each recognized heritage area shall be kept on file at the Authority and at the office of the county clerk where the recognized heritage area is located.

text.section: Designation of a heritage area by the Authority as a recognized heritage area establishes eligibility for matching grant assistance for the development of management plans.
